intro: Cracca chrysophylla, commonly known as the golden leaf cracca, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically a vibrant green with a slight golden hue. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, which bloom in clusters during the spring and summer months. Native to certain regions of Africa, it thrives in well-drained soils and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
